review: Amazon Fire TV makes the prime membership and the streaming way better. Fire has a menu screen that allows for easy searching. It is easy to add items to the watch list for later or stream them immediately. Additionally, although this is obviously most beneficial for prime members, it does contain items that are not eligible for prime as well. The device makes it easy to distinguish and makes the streaming experience much better. However, I think this would be redundant for anyone with a Smart TV but that is just my opinion.

author: johnblaze

review: The Amazon Fire TV is very fast............for watching Amazon content either on WIFI or direct Ethernet.  The search function is also very accurate..............for finding content on Amazon Prime.  The games are, meh.  I realized pretty quickly that I had no desire to use this for games, it's a total failure as an even casual gaming device so far, but then again, I'm a gamer so I have higher expectations than non-gamers.  Overall, this streaming box works absolutely beautifully for streaming your Amazon content.The remote controller is really fantastic, too.  It's small and has a nice feel that doesn't get slippery or plastered with finger prints.  It works via bluetooth so no need to point it right at the box (you can hide the box behind your TV).  It's also very responsive.Outside of Amazon though, it's a ridiculous failure.The Netflix app is unacceptably slow.  It's also an antiquated version of Netflix compared to other Netflix apps on other devices.  I can stream Netflix over WIFI to my Google Chrome dongle at much higher quality and without the general lag that the Amazon Fire TV gives.  It's a total failure and if Netflix is your primary portal for watching TV and movies, like it is with me, then this box is a complete failure for you.The other thing that really bothers me about this thing is that you can't turn it off without unplugging it.  I don't like the idea of having things ON all of the time, even in "sleep" mode.  There has been times when my Netflix app has continued playing through a series (lagging the whole time, I'm sure) while I sleep so I come back and I'm 1 and a 1/2 episodes ahead of where I left off.I bought the Fire TV on launch day and boy did I learn a lesson... I should have waited but I let the hype get me excited.  I didn't post this review until 7+ months later because I wanted to give Amazon the benefit of the doubt that this is a new product and see if they would update their Netflix app or their UI, however, nothing (visually) has updated and it appears that they are done with the Fire TV and are moving on.  It's disappointing because I love Amazon content and I enjoy my Prime membership and TV / Movie content I get with it, however, I'll stick with the Amazon app on my other streaming devices from now on.  Hopefully, I can unwind this purchase in the secondary market.*UPDATE*-----------------------------------------------------------------All of the issues I previously have had with the Fire TV box are solved now.  It runs Netflix and all of the other apps (FINALLY HBO GO!!!) like a charm.  You can even chromecast to it!  This is now my main entertainment box that I use for everything.  Very glad I made this purchase.
